doc.previous: Harvard is a founding member of the Association of American Universities[94] and remains a research university with "very high" research activity and a "comprehensive" doctoral program across the arts, sciences, engineering, and medicine.[19] Research and development expenditures in 2011 totaled $649.7 million, 27th among American universities.[95]
doc.after: The Harvard University Library System is centered in Widener Library in Harvard Yard and comprises nearly 80 individual libraries holding over 18 million volumes.[21][22] According to the American Library Association, this makes it the largest academic library in the United States, and one of the largest in the world.[22]
